Description: Femme d'Egypte dans le harem, one of two studies for Plate 74 of the artist's 'Voyage dans la Basse et la Haute Egypte, pendant les campagnes du Général Bonaparte', 1802; Egyptian woman, seated on the floor in profile to left, wearing long dress and turban, holding beads in her right hand Black chalk
Producer name: Drawn by: Baron Dominique Vivant Denon
Curator's comments: Engraved by Benoît Louis Prévost for Denon's 'Voyage...' (there is no copy of the book the Department. The B.L. copy is at 458.h.12). Lit.: P. Rosenberg (ed.), exhib. cat., Paris, Musée du Louvre, 'Dominique-Vivant Denon: l'oeil de Napoléon', 1999, no. 95
Exhibition history: 1999/2000 Oct-Jan, Paris, Musée du Louvre, Denon 1747-1825 2000 Mar-June, Rome, Museo Napoleonico, Bonaparte in Egitto
Associated names: Associated with: Napoléon I, Emperor of the French (Napoleon)
Illustration to: Baron Dominique Vivant Denon
Associated titles: Voyage dans la Basse et la Haute Egypte
